description:
POSITION SUMMARY

The Business Development Manager (BDM) deepens and broadens existing customer and partner relationships, builds new relationships with project gate-keepers, generates new opportunities that fit the company’s capabilities, and identifies opportunities to expand the company’s capabilities and revenue. The role will require development of strategic relationships and opportunities for large-project prospects leading to high-value closed-won deals.

The role requires prospecting, developing relationships with the principals in those opportunities, and selling the appropriate MT2 services that meet their needs utilizing strategic solutions. Further, this individual is to adhere to the MT2 values and culture while working to achieve this objective.

The BDM will identify key engineering and consulting firms, as well as state and federal EPA/DEP entities, and introduce them to MT2’s capabilities, leading to strategic opportunities through those organizations for MT2 to pursue. Those relationships will be nurtured and managed to generate future sales leads.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

· Develop strong relationships with leadership, decision makers, and influencers within existing and new customer accounts and within the industry engineers/consultants and regulators.

· Ability to communicate Company qualifications and unique capabilities to new customer and project influencer base.

· Engage in the entire sales cycle utilizing customer fiscal year opportunities, matching customer needs, and providing strategic solutions by overcoming sales challenges.

· Proficiently negotiate and manage complex sales and purchase agreements, from initial prospecting through job/project close.

· Lead a team of sales professionals to meet company sales goals.

· Maintain all activities and related sales opportunity funnels in the CRM and develop/distribute internal reports.

· Effectively partner and cooperate with the Estimating/Proposal team, and Sales team, as well as the Operations team in the completion of proposals and the job/project.

· Develop and implement effective plans to achieve order, revenue, and margin projections.

· Penetrate target accounts across the United States.

· Build customer plans including sales potential, opportunities, contacts, and other information as needed.

· Identify MT2 business potential and new business opportunities.

· Collaborate with industry contacts to discover customer leads.

· Understand customer needs, expectations, wants and demands to provide customer solutions.

· Monitor competitive activity and develop plans to countermeasure.

· Create and implement strategies to identify and develop target accounts.

· Mentor and coach Regional Sales Manager and Inside Sales Manager positions.

· Serve as an industry expert on panels, at conferences and in various other content.

· Participate in strategic planning sessions and sales forecast development and profit forecasts.

· Gather, interpret, and disseminate market data. Implement strategies to recognize new revenue and margin opportunities.

· Assist with strategic marketing planning and execution.

QUALIFICATIONS

· Bachelor’s degree with focus in Environmental sciences, engineering, or business, or equivalent experience in professional sales.

· 5 yrs minimum of professional experience in sales or technical consulting of customers.

· Work independently with little supervision, but also strong sense of teamwork. Self-starter and a quick learner.

· Demonstrated communication and presentation skills and the ability to communicate at a level with customers with decision-making authority.

· Experience leading and coaching other sales professionals, including setting goals, developing their skillsets, and managing their work effort.

· Experience in environmental sciences field a plus.

· Must be able to fluently read, write and speak English. Bilingual is a plus.

· Customer focus; results driven; well-organized and able to handle several multi-tasks simultaneously; team building / relationship building; analytical thinking / decision making.

· Desired knowledge: Microsoft Office Package (Excel, Word, PowerPoint), Outlook, Teams, CRM.

· Extensive travel may be required.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:
• 401(k) matching
• Dental insurance
• Health insurance
• Life insurance
• Paid time off
• Professional development assistance
• Vision insurance

Schedule:
• Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:
• Bonus opportunities

Experience:
• Business development: 5 years (Required)
• Environmental Services / EPA: 4 years (Required)

Willingness to travel:
• 50% (Required)

Work Location: Remote
